awd_titl_txt: I-Corps: A Deep Learning Toolbox for Subsurface Imaging in Exploration for Oil and Gas
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this I-Corps project is to meet the increasing demand of energy consumption and maintain a healthy oil and gas output in the US. Machine vision and automatic data picking are viable approaches to keep up with the data multiplication of seismic surveys. The proposed product is the first one that is aiming at minimizing labor burden in seismic data processing by using a deep neural network with a novel and efficient transfer learning strategy. If successful, the novel deep transfer learning approach will build the foundation for adopting advanced deep neural network technologies by many other industrial applications. In addition to the Oil and Gas industry, the product can also be used in other important areas such as geothermal energy exploration.

This I-Corps project is to explore the market potential for a product to automatically identify unique patterns embedded in the seismic data. The intellectual merit of this proposal lies in the theme of a novel deep transfer learning approach, which will ease the training burden of the deep neural network and solve the training data shortage problem by utilizing discriminative unsupervised feature learning to learn high-level representations that are more invariant to variations between the synthetic and real data. The innovativeness of our proposal is that it is aimed to build a reliable system to perform various pattern recognition tasks required by the seismic data processing and be adaptive to different datasets acquired through seismic surveys. This product has the potential to save up to 20% to 50% of the total seismic processing time.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
The major goal of the project is to identify the commercialization opportunities of a deep learning-based software package for subsurface sensing technologies. Our market discovery activities start with seismic imaging and signal processing for the Exploration and Production (E&P) of the Oil and Gas industry. These activities lead us to new industry sectors in geothermal exploration and carbon capture and storage. Particularly, the project will allow us to learn the customers' needs, recognize customer segments, define the value proposition, understand cost and revenue stream, and construct a business model through in-depth market discoveries. The outcome of the project will serve as the cornerstone for us to convert applied research results into commercial products.

 

During the I-Corps project, we participated in I-Corps Cohort and conducted more than a hundred interviews. Extensive market discovery activities allow us to identify the current "pain points" of the industry for seismic data processing and locate the needs and the niche market for machine learning-based products. During the covid 19 pandemic, we attended multiple events online and explored commercial opportunities for carbon capture and storage (CCS) and the exploration and development of geothermal energy. The market size of carbon capture and storage is significantly increased according to our market survey. Machine learning-based subsurface sensing will help to improve CO2 leakage detection and provide high-quality fracture imaging for geothermal development. Through the I-Corps project, we build a collaborative relationship with multiple startup companies. Together, we have submitted two SBIR/STTR Phase II proposals and one SBIR/STTR Phase I proposal. One of the Phase II proposals is awarded. Market discovery supported by the I-Corps project contributes greatly to the Identification of functionalities that are marketable and have the highest commercial value to be included in the product. Two undergraduate and two graduate students have been involved in this project. The I-Corps training helps them to develop entrepreneurship skills and obtain market research experiences. The technology and product promoted by the project will help to explore and develop sustainable energy resources, minimize risks, and reduce environmental impacts.

 


Last Modified: 09/14/2022
Modified by: Xuqing Wu
